title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: We askedhim how far we were from the town, and were delighted to hear it wasonly about two miles away. It was after ten o'clock when we arrived atHelmsdale, tired and footsore, but just in time to secure lodgings forthe night at the Commercial Inn.

title: A journal of a residence ... in London; including excursions through various parts of England; and a short tour in France and Scotland; in the years 1823 and 1824
author: Wheaton, Nathaniel Sheldon.
snippet: Sheffield is 162 miles from London. We were set down atthe " Commercial Inn," where I found very comfortablequarters, the landlord himself acting as waiter.
